data.title: Black History Month Day 19 Sarah Vaughan Born: March 27, 1924 Died: April 3, 1990 (aged 66) Resting Place: Glendale Cemetery,...
data.meta_description:
9 likes, 3 comments - thegrimtripper on February 19, 2023: "Black History Month Day 19

Sarah Vaughan 
Born: March 27, 1924 
Died: April 3, 1990 (aged 66)
Resting Place: Glendale Cemetery, Bloomfield, NJ

Fun(eral) Facts: Sarah Vaughan was an American jazz singer nicknamed "Sassy" and "The Divine One,‚Äù she won two Grammy Awards, including the Lifetime Achievement Award, and was nominated for a total of nine Grammy Awards. 

In 1989, Vaughan's health began to decline, although she rarely revealed any hints of this in her performances. During a run at New York's Blue Note Jazz Club in 1989, she was diagnosed with lung cancer and was too ill to finish the last day of what would turn out to be her final series of public performances. She had been a heavy smoker. Vaughan returned to her home in California to begin chemotherapy and spent her final months alternating stays in the hospital and at home. She grew weary of the struggle and demanded to be taken home, where at the age of 66 she died on the evening of April 3, 1990, while watching Laker Girls, a television movie featuring her adopted daughter, Paris Vaughan. 
.
